thread.title: Bayern v Arsenal: Theo Walcott among four most important players, says Carlo Ancelotti | Metro News
thread.title_full: Bayern v Arsenal: Theo Walcott among four most important players, says Carlo Ancelotti | Metro News

author: Simon Rice For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Bayern v Arsenal: Theo Walcott among four most important players, says Carlo Ancelotti | Metro News

organizations.name: carlo ancelotti | metro news simon rice

text:
Simon Rice for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 8:07 am Bayern Munich manager Carlo Ancelotti (Getty) 
Carlo Ancelotti has picked out Arsenal ’s four most important players ahead of tonight’s Champions League tie against his Bayern Munich side. 
However, the former Chelsea manager’s selections may surprise some considering not all of them are guaranteed to start the match. 
Speaking ahead of tonight’s Round of 16 first leg at the Allianz Arena, Ancelotti said: ‘This group of Arsenal players is really good because most are young with lots of quality. 
‘But there is a good mix of experience. 
‘Their most important players have lots of quality. Alexis [Sanchez], [Mesut] Ozil, [Olivier] Giroud and [Theo] Walcott. Up front they are a very dangerous team.’ Giroud? Most important? Really? (Getty) 
Few would disagree with the pick of Sanchez, however Ozil’s form has been dreadful, leading to speculation he could be dropped for tonight’s game. Meanwhile Giroud is unlikely to start.
